text: Question 11 Which of the following statements about synchronous and asynchronous 1/0 is NOT true? An ISR is invoked on completion of I/0 in synchronous 1/0 but not in asynchronous 1/0 In both synchronous and asynchronous I/0, an ISR (Interrupt Service Routine) is invoked after completion of the I/0 A process making a synchronous I/0 call waits until I/0 is complete, 0 but a process making an asynchronous I/0 call does not wait for completion of the I/0 In the case of synchronous I/0, the process waiting for the completion of 1/0 is woken up by the ISR that is invoked after the completion of I/0 GATE CSE 2008 Computer Organization
